channel.title: Open DNS
channel.description:
a program my friends dad uses to block almost every site ever >.< he cant get on 4chan, myspace, facebook, sendspace etc.
you guys know anyway to get past it besides proxies?
thanks,

item.title: Open DNS
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:301071”]OpenDNS is not a program, it’s a DNS service, and it is awesome.

A proxy will probably not get you past it either, what will get past it is if you set your own DNS servers that aren’t OpenDNS.

edit: disregard lawl’s post, because as I said, it is not a program.[/quote]
i dont see anywhere that he says opendns is whats blocking him?? i assumed he meant it as an alternative to proxy

Read full topic

item.title: Open DNS
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

OpenDNS is not a program, it’s a DNS service, and it is awesome.

A proxy will probably not get you past it either, what will get past it is if you set your own DNS servers that aren’t OpenDNS.

edit: disregard lawl’s post, because as I said, it is not a program.

Read full topic

item.title: Open DNS
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

assuming its xp or vista,
http://ophcrack.sourceforge.net/
run it on his comp, then get the admin pass, login as admin, uninstall program, done.

though if its xp you can probably go into safemode and remove the admin pass there

Read full topic

item.title: Open DNS
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

Ok, you can use another computer to download a key stroke recorder/key logger [doesn’t necessarily mean its a virus. You can script one your self if you know how to.] then put it on a usb. Now go to the computer your ‘friend’ uses, and install or run the script there. Leave it on until your dad needs to disable it or something and when he types the password, retrieve the password and disable it. Then when you’re done delete the logs, then simply re-enable it.

Read full topic
